definition: to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to win a championship/to come out top/to take the cup
to flatter/to laud sb's accomplishments/adulation
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
lit. all the stars cup themselves around the moon (idiom, from Analects); fig. to view sb as core figure/to group around a revered leader/to revolve around sb
straight man (supporting role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to react with exasperation to the silliness of the funny man 逗哏[dou4 gen2]
to read (honorific: e.g. your distinguished article)
to praise an actor/adulation
to hug stinky feet/(fig.) to bootlick
to hold up with both hands
erhua variant of 捧角[peng3 jue2]
to praise to the skies
lit. to hold up to the skies/fig. to praise lavishly
to praise sb in a way that puts them at a disadvantage

sentences.english: In answer to the ring, appeared a page boy with a silver soup tureen.
sentences.chinese: 按过铃，一个小男仆就捧了一只盛汤的银器进来。

sentences.english: And Louise holds a handful of rain.
Crowning "stars" among literary upstarts is killing them.
sentences.chinese: 把所谓“明星”捧做文唐袈贵即是抹杀他们。

sentences.english: She clutched Pat’s painting to her stomach.
sentences.chinese: 她将帕特的油画捧在肚子上。

sentences.english: I sit down along a brooklet with a booklet in hand.
sentences.chinese: 我手捧一本小册子，坐在一条小河旁。

sentences.english: Mary Ann, his wife, passed by with her bookkeeping binder.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子玛丽安捧着出纳簿从边上走过。

sentences.english: Xiao Qing held the wounded sparrow in both hands.
sentences.chinese: 小晴双手捧着那只受伤的小麻雀。

sentences.english: I haven't got the shamrock, but i'm holding the hope!
sentences.chinese: 我没有三叶草，但我手捧希望。

sentences.english: He is running to me with some flowers in his hands.
sentences.chinese: 他手里捧着花，向我跑过来。

sentences.english: He was praised to the skies by Puccini and Schoenberg.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被普契尼和勋伯格捧上了天。

sentences.english: North Korea will win the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜将会捧回大力神杯。

sentences.english: Just as the angel bears a lily-stem in the Annunciation.
sentences.chinese: 就像《天使报喜图》中手捧百合干枝的天使。

sentences.english: He groped for an armful of wood and hastened back into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他摸索着抱了一捧柴，匆匆回到屋里。

sentences.english: The pair, who are a couple in real life, also took home the Best Kiss award.
sentences.chinese: 这对于现实糊口情侣还捧走了最佳亲嘴奖。

sentences.english: Finally a note when it came to a halt, the old class stand in front of holding a pile of papers.
sentences.chinese: 当最后一节音符停下时，老班捧着一叠试卷立于门前。

sentences.english: Sudden growth in the holding cup of coffee, which is when you miss the feelings of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 捧着杯暖烘烘的咖啡，里面却是思念发酵时的心情。

definition: crimson
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to flatter/to laud sb's accomplishments/adulation
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to bear/to stand/to endure
to place/to put aside/to shelve
to rub against/to walk slowly/(coll.) to freeload
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
variant of 捏[nie1]
in hand/(a situation is) in sb's hands
to estimate/to guess/to figure/to surmise
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
adoptive father (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to offer
to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
hot tea
to enclose/to cover with the hand (one's eyes, nose or ears)/to cover up (an affair)/contrary/to contradict
